section.title: Ubuntu,Linux Mint and Debian
section.para: Stellarium is included in the default Ubuntu (and Mint and Debian) repositories and Ubuntu users can install Stellarium via the Software Center. Open software center, search for 'stellarium' and hit install. As simple as that. Command line installation is done like so:

For those wishing to have a more bleeding edge version of Stellarium, there's a PPA repository that is updated more often. You can add the repository manually to install a more recent version of Stellarium
section.programlisting: sudo add-apt-repository ppa:stellarium/stellarium-releases sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install stellarium

section.title: Installing from source
section.para: The source can be downloaded from http://sourceforge.net/projects/stellarium/files/Stellarium-sources/. Dowload the latest source tarball. At the moment of writing this document, the version is 0.12.4. Save the tarball in a suitable location like /opt

section.title: Installing Build Dependencies
section.para: The essential packages for build are QT library, gcc, g++, cmake, gettext, Zlib and open GL library. They can be installed using the default package managers of your distribution. On Ubuntu and Debian use the dev packages of the library
section.programlisting: sudo apt-get install build-essential cmake zlib1g-dev libglu1-mesa-dev libgl1-mesa-dev gcc g++ gettext libqt4-dev
section.para: For other distros, use the default package manager like pacman, zypper or urpmi to install the corresponding libraries

section.title: Installing the source package
section.para: Extract the source package and then use cmake to configure the build and then use make and make install to install the build in your machine
section.programlisting: tar zxvf stellarium-0.12.4.tar.gz cd stellarium-0.12.4 mkdir -p builds/unix cd builds/unix sudo cmake -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/opt/stellarium ../.. make sudo make install

section.title: Mac OS
section.para: Download the package file from the link http://sourceforge.net/projects/stellarium/files/Stellarium-MacOSX/0.12.4/Stellarium-0.12.4.dmg/download
Click on the Downloaded file to install stellarium on Mac.

section.title: Windows
section.para: Download the relevant package file from the link http://sourceforge.net/projects/stellarium/files/Stellarium-win32/0.12.4/. Choose the file appropriate for your CPU architecture.
Double click on the file and follow the instructions while interacting with the installation window.

section.title: Basic Configuration
section.para: The default location when you run Stellarium for the first time should be set by hitting F6 and then choosing a location either by clicking on the map or by choosing from the list provided or simply by keying in the co-ordinates of your current location. You can click on the "Use as default" checkbox to set the selected location as the default.
You can set some options in the configuration window (F2). Help is only an F1 key away.
